description: Devotees of Hinduism from across Britain and the rest of the world are to converge on Edinburgh for a notable date in the faith’ s history. In his Easter Sunday homily at St Mary’ s Cathedral in Edinburgh, Cardinal Keith O’ Brien described how the scandal had caused“ great hatred” to be directed at innocent priests and had left ordinary Catholics feeling“ demoralised...
text:
5 years ago

Devotees of Hinduism from across Britain and the rest of the world are to
converge on Edinburgh for a notable date in the faith's history. Sunday will
see the official opening of the capital's first temple and cultural centre in
St Andrew Place in Leith with a colourful pageant of dancers and traditionally
dressed followers. Hundreds of people are attending Edinburgh Mandir Mahotsav
2015. This weekend's events will culminate in a blessing of the renovated
building by invited Sadhus, scholars and priests.

10 years ago

The leader of Scotland's Catholics called for a "resurrection in the life of
the church" as he joined senior archbishops in making a series of apologies
over the sex abuse scandal. In his Easter Sunday homily at St Mary's Cathedral
in Edinburgh, Cardinal Keith O'Brien described how the scandal had caused
"great hatred" to be directed at innocent priests and had left ordinary
Catholics feeling "demoralised and confused" by the "many evils" perpetrated
by paedophile priests.

25 years ago

A man convicted of stabbing tennis star Monica Seles remained free today on a
two-year suspended jail sentence after a judge in Hamburg rejected an appeal
by prosecutors and the injured athlete's lawyer to put him in prison. The
judge upheld the sentence given in October 1993 to unemployed Guenther Parche,
who knifed Seles in the back during a tennis tournament. Parche later admitted
he carried out the attack so that his idol, German tennis player Steffi Graf,
could again top the world rankings.

CREDIT: Drew Allan

title: 5 years ago Devotees of Hinduism from across Britain and ... [Derived Headline]
html:
5 years ago

Devotees of Hinduism from across Britain and the rest of the world are to converge on Edinburgh for a notable date in the faith’s history. Sunday will see the official opening of the capital’s first temple and cultural centre in St Andrew Place in Leith with a colourful pageant of dancers and traditionally dressed followers. Hundreds of people are attending Edinburgh Mandir Mahotsav 2015. This weekend’s events will culminate in a blessing of the renovated building by invited Sadhus, scholars and priests.

10 years ago

The leader of Scotland’s Catholics called for a “resurrection in the life of the church” as he joined senior archbishops in making a series of apologies over the sex abuse scandal. In his Easter Sunday homily at St Mary’s Cathedral in Edinburgh, Cardinal Keith O’Brien described how the scandal had caused “great hatred” to be directed at innocent priests and had left ordinary Catholics feeling “demoralised and confused” by the “many evils” perpetrated by paedophile priests.

25 years ago

A man convicted of stabbing tennis star Monica Seles remained free today on a two-year suspended jail sentence after a judge in Hamburg rejected an appeal by prosecutors and the injured athlete’s lawyer to put him in prison. The judge upheld the sentence given in October 1993 to unemployed Guenther Parche, who knifed Seles in the back during a tennis tournament. Parche later admitted he carried out the attack so that his idol, German tennis player Steffi Graf, could again top the world rankings.

CREDIT: Drew Allan
